main event: Two unidentified objects were sighted over Capitol Heights, Maryland on Oct 3, 1953 at 2:00 PM. The objects appeared to be round in shape, the size of three times the average star or small grapefruit, and were white or starlike in color. They were observed traveling in a side-by-side formation and appeared independent of each other.
interesting points: The objects were approximately 300 yards away and were observed for 20-30 seconds, drifting apart in distance.
No trail exhaust or glow, and no sound was reported despite the close proximity of the objects.
The observers, including a Capitol employee and a student from Maryland University, provided details of the sighting.
The flight path of the objects was described as straight and level, with a duration of approximately 30 seconds.
The report includes information about the visibility and ceiling at Bolling AFB on the day of the sighting.
sighted object: two unidentified round objects in the sky
witnesses: Civil observers, including a Capitol employee and a student from Maryland University
